channel.title: briefUpdatesPoliticsOffshootNL
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from briefUpdatesPoliticsOffshootNL, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Photos: New Year's celebrations from NYC to Sydney, as world welcomes 2026
item.description: Millions of Americans across the U.S. joined people around the world in New Year's celebrations ringing in 2026 on Thursday. The big picture: South Pa...

item.title: NYE Washington Monument illumination kicks off Trump's yearlong America 250 celebration
item.description: President Trump's initiative to commemorate the 250th year of the founding of the U.S. kicked off with the projection of images on the Washington Monu...

item.title: Trump shoots down two bipartisan bills in first vetoes of second term
item.description: President Trump has issued the first two vetoes of his second term, rejecting bills with bipartisan support that would have aided a Colorado water pro...

item.title: White House lays out nine-week timeline to win approval for Trump’s ballroom
item.description: Trump is seeking to gain approvals for his ballroom in just over two months that have taken other large projects years to complete.

item.title: Trump is reconstituting the Fine Arts panel set to review his ballroom
item.description: The White House is seeking members likely to clear the way for President Donald Trump’s controversial ballroom and other projects.

item.title: These states may decide on abortion laws in 2026

item.title: Trump backs off National Guard deployments in Los Angeles, Chicago, Portland

item.title: Chief justice says rule of law is strong at time of rising concerns
item.description: Chief Justice John Roberts said in his annual year-end report on the judiciary that the nation’s founding charters remain robust.

item.title: Democrats tout another special election as boost for party ahead of midterms
item.description: Renee Hardman’s convincing special-election win offers a hopeful signal for Democrats looking to 2026. She becomes the first Black woman elected to th...

item.title: Longtime MAGA ally Boebert lashes out at Trump over veto
item.description: The Colorado Republican said she hopes Trump’s action on a water infrastructure bill benefiting her district “has nothing to do with political retalia...

item.title: Ex-Trump voters swung hard to Democrats over costs in NJ & VA, new research shows
item.description: Voters who backed Donald Trump in 2024 and swung to Democrats in this year's Virginia and New Jersey elections did so over economic concerns, accordin...

item.title: Vance tries to thread affordability needle in Rust Belt
item.description: The vice president fine-tunes Trump’s economic message, but he's only got so much wiggle room.

item.title: Democrats think they’ve found their 2026 message — and Miami just backed it up
item.description: In races across the country, Democrats focused on promises to make life more affordable — even as they offered contrasting approaches.

item.title: Voters sour on Trump’s handling of the economy in new poll
item.description: The White House plans to make affordability a key selling point for Republicans across the board as the 2026 midterm elections come into focus.

item.title: What to Know About China's DeepSeek AI
item.description: The Chinese upstart says it has trained high-performing AI models cheaply, without using the most advanced chips.

item.title: Reid Hoffman Raises $24.6 Million for AI Cancer-Research Startup
item.description: The LinkedIn co-founder is starting Manas AI with “The Emperor of All Maladies” author Siddhartha Mukherjee.

item.title: Tech, Media & Telecom Roundup: Market Talk
item.description: DeepSeek, SoFi and more in the latest Market Talks covering Technology, Media and Telecom.

item.title: Silicon Valley Is Raving About a Made-in-China AI Model
item.description: DeepSeek is called “amazing and impressive” despite working with less-advanced chips.

item.title: Can an App Replace a Personal Trainer? I Tested Nearly a Dozen to Find Out
item.description: Apps can add flexibility and freshness to your routine. Just try not to get injured.
